segments.pli: Aṅguttara Nikāya 7
segments.en: Numbered Discourses 7

segments.pli: 7. Mahāvagga
segments.en: 7. The Great Chapter

segments.pli: 73. Sunettasutta
segments.en: 73. About Sunetta

segments.pli: “Bhūtapubbaṃ, bhikkhave, sunetto nāma satthā ahosi titthakaro kāmesu vītarāgo.
segments.en: “Once upon a time, mendicants, there was a Teacher called Sunetta. He was a religious founder and was free of sensual desire.

segments.pli: Sunettassa kho pana, bhikkhave, satthuno anekāni sāvakasatāni ahesuṃ.
segments.en: He had many hundreds of disciples.

segments.pli: Sunetto satthā sāvakānaṃ brahmalokasahabyatāya dhammaṃ desesi.
segments.en: He taught them the path to rebirth in the company of Brahmā.

segments.pli: Ye kho pana, bhikkhave, sunettassa satthuno brahmalokasahabyatāya dhammaṃ desentassa cittāni nappasādesuṃ te kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā apāyaṃ duggatiṃ vinipātaṃ nirayaṃ upapajjiṃsu.
segments.en: Those lacking confidence in Sunetta were—when their body broke up, after death—reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell.

segments.pli: Ye kho pana, bhikkhave, sunettassa satthuno brahmalokasahabyatāya dhammaṃ desentassa cittāni pasādesuṃ te kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā sugatiṃ saggaṃ lokaṃ upapajjiṃsu.
segments.en: Those full of confidence in Sunetta were—when their body broke up, after death—reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm.

segments.pli: Bhūtapubbaṃ, bhikkhave, mūgapakkho nāma satthā ahosi … pe …
segments.en: Once upon a time there was a teacher called Mūgapakkha …

segments.pli: aranemi nāma satthā ahosi … pe …
segments.en: Aranemi …

segments.pli: kuddālako nāma satthā ahosi … pe …
segments.en: Kuddāla …

segments.pli: hatthipālo nāma satthā ahosi … pe …
segments.en: Hatthipāla …

segments.pli: jotipālo nāma satthā ahosi … pe …
segments.en: Jotipāla …

segments.pli: arako nāma satthā ahosi titthakaro kāmesu vītarāgo.
segments.en: Araka. He was a religious founder and was free of sensual desire.

segments.pli: Arakassa kho pana, bhikkhave, satthuno anekāni sāvakasatāni ahesuṃ.
segments.en: He had many hundreds of disciples.

segments.pli: Arako nāma satthā sāvakānaṃ brahmalokasahabyatāya dhammaṃ desesi.
segments.en: He taught them the way to rebirth in the company of Brahmā.

segments.pli: Ye kho pana, bhikkhave, arakassa satthuno brahmalokasahabyatāya dhammaṃ desentassa cittāni nappasādesuṃ, te kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā apāyaṃ duggatiṃ vinipātaṃ nirayaṃ upapajjiṃsu.
segments.en: Those lacking confidence in Araka were—when their body broke up, after death—reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell.

segments.pli: Ye kho pana, bhikkhave, arakassa satthuno brahmalokasahabyatāya dhammaṃ desentassa cittāni pasādesuṃ, te kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā sugatiṃ saggaṃ lokaṃ upapajjiṃsu.
segments.en: Those full of confidence in Araka were—when their body broke up, after death—reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm.

segments.pli: Taṃ kiṃ maññatha, bhikkhave,
segments.en: What do you think, mendicants?

segments.pli: yo ime satta satthāre titthakare kāmesu vītarāge anekasataparivāre sasāvakasaṅghe paduṭṭhacitto akkoseyya paribhāseyya, bahuṃ so apuññaṃ pasaveyyā”ti?
segments.en: If someone with malicious intent were to abuse and insult these seven teachers with their hundreds of followers, would they not make much bad karma?”

segments.pli: “Evaṃ, bhante”.
segments.en: “Yes, sir.”

segments.pli: “Yo, bhikkhave, ime satta satthāre titthakare kāmesu vītarāge anekasataparivāre sasāvakasaṅghe paduṭṭhacitto akkoseyya paribhāseyya, bahuṃ so apuññaṃ pasaveyya.
segments.en: “They would indeed.

segments.pli: Yo ekaṃ diṭṭhisampannaṃ puggalaṃ paduṭṭhacitto akkosati paribhāsati, ayaṃ tato bahutaraṃ apuññaṃ pasavati.
segments.en: But someone who abuses and insults a single person accomplished in view with malicious intent makes even more bad karma.

segments.pli: Taṃ kissa hetu?
segments.en: Why is that?

segments.pli: Nāhaṃ, bhikkhave, ito bahiddhā evarūpiṃ khantiṃ vadāmi yathāmaṃ sabrahmacārīsu.
segments.en: I say that any injury done by those outside of the Buddhist community does not compare with what is done to one’s own spiritual companions.

segments.pli: Tasmātiha, bhikkhave, evaṃ sikkhitabbaṃ:
segments.en: So you should train like this:

segments.pli: ‘na no sabrahmacārīsu cittāni paduṭṭhāni bhavissantī’ti.
segments.en: ‘We will have no malicious intent for our spiritual companions.’

segments.pli: Evañhi vo, bhikkhave, sikkhitabban”ti.
segments.en: That’s how you should train.”

segments.pli: Navamaṃ.

sections.title: “Once upon a time, mendicants, there was a Teacher…

suttaplex.blurb: There have been many great teachers in the past, who should not be reviled. But reviling a single noble disciple is even more serious.
